COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 870/88  of 30 March 1988  providing for the granting of aid for the private storage of short flax fibres and of hemp fibres
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Intervention agencies of producer Member States shall grant private storage aid for short flax fibres and for hemp fibres of Communty origin pursuant to the provisions of Regulation (EEC) No 1524/71 and of this Regulation.

1. The maximum quantity per contract shall be 200 tonnes.
2. Contracts may be concluded only with persons in possession of the product on 31 December 1987.

1. Without prejudice to Article 8 (2) (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 1172/71, contracts shall be concluded for a term of six months.
2. Contracts must be concluded not later than 6 May 1988.

1. The aid shall be 1 ECU per 100 kilograms per month.
2. Should Article 8 (2) (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 1172/71 be applied, the aid shall be reduced in proportion to the reduction in the term of the contract.
For the purposes of this Regulation a month means a period of 30 days.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
